Beurs van Berlage Building
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Berlage, Hendrik Petrus (Dutch architect and industrial designer, 1856-1934) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: View of open floor exchange area from back

The Beurs van Berlage is a building on the Damrak, in the center of Amsterdam. It was designed as a commodity exchange ... and constructed between 1896 and 1903. It influenced many modernist architects, in particular functionalists and the Amsterdam School. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beurs_van_Berlage [work]
